entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 4:26AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS CONTINUE TODAY... Anomalously warm and dry conditions will continue today. High temperatures will reach the upper 70s to mid 80s with minimum relative humidities dropping to 25 to 30 percent. These conditions combined with west wind gusts of 10 to 20 mph will result in elevated fire weather potential.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 4:19AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS CONTINUE TODAY... Anomalously warm and dry conditions will continue today. High temperatures will reach the mid to upper 80s away from the immediate coast with minimum relative humidities dropping to 20 to 30 percent. These conditions combined with west wind gusts around 20 mph will result in elevated fire weather potential.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 12 at 7:33PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: Conditions will again be conducive for fire growth and spread from late morning into early evening on Thursday if ignition occurs. Relative humidity in most places will fall to 20 to 30 percent, with west winds 10 to 15 mph occasionally gusting up to 20 mph. Listen to NOAA All Hazards Weather Radio or visit our web Site at http://weather.gov/nyc for further details or updates.
